li.#text: Students apply on this application for student financial assistance to attend part-time post-secondary studies.
Application for Financial Assistance for Part-Time Post-Secondary Studies 2025-26

Description._pagezerocontent:
This Government of Alberta form cannot be opened using your web browser.

Please save the file to your computer by right-clicking the link to the form and select 'save as'.

Open the form using Acrobat Adobe Reader.

Download free: https://get.adobe.com/reader/

To view step-by-step instructions on how to open this form visit:

https://cfr.forms.gov.ab.ca/content/formopenhelp.html

Please note that this form will not work on a mobile device.

p.#text: Application for Financial Assistance for Part-Time Post-Secondary Studies 2025-26

value.text: Eligibility Requirements for Part-Time Loans and Grants
●  You must be a resident of Alberta. This means that:
-  Alberta is the last province you have lived in for 12 consecutive months without being a full-time post-secondary student, or
●  Any federal or provincial loans you have must be in good standing.
●  If you are in default on your Canada Apprentice Loan, you are not eligible to receive further student financial assistance until your restriction is removed.
●  Courses must be part of an approved program of study and taken for credit.
●  All $ amounts must be submitted in Canadian dollars.
●  Apply at least 60 days before your course(s) start.
●  Ensure Alberta Student Aid receives this application at least 30 days before this application’s period of study end date.
●  Part-time student aid is intended to help cover the cost of tuition, books, travel, and daycare (if applicable).
●  If you have received previous part-time student aid, you must successfully complete all previously funded courses to receive student aid on a subsequent application.
●  Section 5 of this application must be completed and signed by your educational institution.
For All Student Aid Inquiries Call the Alberta Student Aid Service Centre:
●  800-2-529-9242 (outside North America - add the appropriate international access code)
●  Contact the Financial Aid Office at the school you plan to attend
●  Family size means you, your spouse/partner and your dependent children (if applicable).
●  If your family income last year was higher than the amounts listed in the charts but is now lower, you may provide an explanation of your situation and documentation of your current income.

span.#text: Choose X if you do not identify as male or female, or choose to self-identify as X.
Pages A, B and C provide information about funding for part-time students.

value.text: You may be asked to provide your Social Insurance Number, Alberta Student Number (ASN), and/or School Identification Number. Please have these numbers available for reference.

p.#text: If you do not know your ASN, or do not have an ASN, go to:

value.text: You can also call toll-free in Alberta at 310-0000 to have a Request for Alberta Student Number form mailed to you. Due to privacy issues, ASN’s will not be given over the telephone.

span.#text: Pages A, B and C provide information about funding for part-time students.

value.text: In the Charts on Pages B and C
Canada Student Grant for Part-Time Studies
Additional Eligibility Criteria to receive up to a maximum of $2,520 annually in grant funding
Income Threshold Chart (CAD$) Canada Student Grant for Part-Time Studies
(A) Family income* threshold to receive maximum grant amount
(B) Family income* threshold at which eligibility for the grant is cut-off
*Family income from Line 15000 of 2024 income tax form(s) or from the Expected Total Income for 2025 field on the application.
●  The student must be enrolled in 20-59% of a full-time course load.
●  The amount of the grant is based on family income (Line 15000 of 2024 income tax form(s) or Expected Total Income for 2025) and family size.
Canada Student Grant for Part-Time Students with Dependants
Additional Eligibility Criteria to receive up to a maximum of $2,688 annually in grant funding
Income Threshold Chart (CAD$) Canada Student Grant for Part-Time Students with Dependants
(A) Family income* threshold to receive maximum grant amount
(B) Family income* threshold at which eligibility for the grant is cut-off
*Family income from Line 15000 of 2024 income tax form(s) or from the Expected Total Income for 2025 field on the application.
Part-Time Canada Student Loans Canada Student Grant for Students with Disabilities Canada Student Grant for Services and Equipment - Students with Disabilities
To be eligible for the above loan or grants, family income (Line 15000 of 2024 income tax form(s) or Expected Total Income for 2025) must be below the Income Threshold in the chart below.

span.#text: Pages A, B and C provide information about funding for part-time students.

value.text: ●  The student must be enrolled in 20-59% of a full-time course load.
●  Students with 1 or 2 dependants may receive up to $56 per week; students with 3 or more dependants may receive up to $84 per week. The maximum grant amount is $2,688 regardless of family size.
●  The grant is for students with dependent children between 0 to 11 years of age who are living with the student and for whom the student and/or their spouse/partner are legally responsible.

●  The grant is also available for students with dependent children with a permanent disability between 12 to 18 years of age, and individuals over 18 years of age with a permanent disability who are wholly dependent on the student.
●  The amount of the grant is based on family income (Line 15000 of 2024 income tax form(s) or Expected Total Income for 2025) and family size.
-  Your part-time Canada Student Loan balance cannot exceed $10,000 at any time.
-  You must be enrolled in 20-59% of a full-time course load.

span.#text: Canada Student Grant for Students with Disabilities and

value.text: -  You must have part-time Canada Student Loan eligibility.
-  You must be a person with a permanent disability or persistent or prolonged disability as defined by the Canada Student Financial Assistance Program and provide acceptable documentation*.

-  You must complete a Schedule 4 the first time you are applying as a student with a documented permanent disability or persistent or prolonged disability. The Disability Advisor/Reviewer at the school may be authorized to sign Schedule 4.
-  For the Services and Equipment grant, you must have a need for exceptional education-related services or equipment required to participate in post-secondary studies.

p.#text: Application for Financial Assistance for Part-Time Post-Secondary Studies 2025-26
Advanced Education is collecting personal information through this document

span.#text: Contact the Alberta Student Aid Service Centre at 1-855-606-2096
email the Alberta Student Aid Protection of Privacy Office at:
send mail to the Alberta Student Aid Privacy Office at PO Box 28000 Stn Main, Edmonton AB T5J 4J4.

value.text: ●  Complete this application if you are taking less than 60% of a Full Course Load. Alberta Student Aid must receive it at least 30 days before this application’s period of study end date.
Questions about the collection of personal information
Is this address where you will live while you are in school? (mandatory)

assist.speak: yes/no is this the address where you will live while you are in school?

value.text: Citizenship Status (Students with a study permit are not eligible for funding from Alberta Student Aid)
Have you lived in Alberta all your life?

span.#text: , is Alberta the last province you have lived in for 12 consecutive months without being a full-time post-secondary student?

value.text: Marital Status (for definition of dependent children, see Section 3)
*You are considered to have a common law partner if:
Date completed/last attended regular High School (excludes upgrading)

span.#text: These documents must be valid at the start of your current study period.

p.#text: *Students who are Protected Persons, including Convention Refugees, may be eligible for student aid. You must submit a copy of your Social Insurance Number card or letter

span.#text: If you wish to declare your Canadian Indigenous heritage as indicated under Section 35 of the

, 1982, check the box that applies to you. Advanced Education uses the information about Canadian First Nations, Métis and Inuit students to measure the effectiveness of programs and to research ways to improve Indigenous student success rates.

p.#text: The following question is optional. Your answer will not affect your eligibility for funding.

value.text: Street Address (add direction, e.g. S, NW, SE)

value.text: ●  you and an individual have lived together in a conjugal relationship continuously for the past one year, or
●  you have declared an individual to have a status equivalent to that of your common law partner under any law of Alberta or of Canada, or
●  you and an individual are living together in a conjugal relationship where there are one or more children of the relationship by birth or adoption.
Alberta Student Aid will contact the person below to obtain your new address, telephone number or email address if unable to contact you using the information you provided on page 1.

value.text: Dependent children mean those children who are living with you and for whom you and/or your spouse/partner are financially responsible.
*Provide documentation of care required for your dependant with a permanent disability.
Number of individuals over 18 years of age who are wholly dependent on you and/or your spouse/partner, as reported on your tax return(s)
*Provide documentation of care required for the individuals with a permanent disability.
How much is your monthly child care cost (after subsidy) for those children  11 years old or younger, and/or children 12 – 18 who have a permanent disability?
Number of dependent children between 0 –11 years of age
Number of dependent children between 12 –18 years of age
●  How many of these dependant(s) have a permanent disability, aged 12 to 18*?

How much is your monthly childcare cost (after subsidy) for those children 
11 years old or younger, and/or children 12 – 18 who have a permanent disability?

value.text: Section 4 - Income and Resource Information Before Starting School
To be completed by the applicant
Applicant’s Total Income from Line 15000 of 2024 tax return. If you have not filed a 2024 Tax Return, enter an estimated 2024 total income from all sources.
Applicant - Do you expect your Total Income for 2025 to be less than 2024?
Is the Applicant currently receiving Assured Income for the Severely Handicapped (AISH)?

Income sources include but are not limited to: employment, foreign income converted to Canadian dollars (CAD), investments, rental properties. Current year pay stubs, record of employment and/or a letter of explanation may be requested to verify this information. If a change to income amounts is submitted after any portion of funding has been paid, grant eligibility will not be reassessed.
To be completed by the applicant’s spouse/partner
Date spouse/partner completed/last attended regular High School
Has the Applicant's spouse/partner lived in Alberta all their life?
●  If no, is Alberta the last province the Applicant's spouse/partner has lived in for 12 consecutive months without being a full-time student?
*If yes, you must claim the income you have made since January of 2025, plus any income you expect to make for the remainder of 2025.

span.#text: If a change to income amounts is submitted after any portion of funding has been paid, grant eligibility will not be reassessed.

p.#text: Income sources include but are not limited to: employment, foreign income converted to Canadian dollars (CAD), investments, rental properties. Current year pay stubs, record of employment and/or a letter of explanation may be requested to verify this information.

value.text: Spouse's/Partner's Total Income from Line 15000 of 2024 tax return. If the Applicant's spouse/partner has not filed a 2024 Tax Return, enter their estimated 2024 total income from all sources.
Spouse/Partner - Do you expect your Total Income for 2025 to be less than 2024?
*If yes, you must claim the income you have made since January of 2025, plus any income you expect to make for the remainder of 2025.

assist.speak: Applicant’s Total Income from Line 15000 of 2024 tax return. If you have not filed a 2024 Tax Return, enter an estimated 2024 total income from all sources.
Spouse's/Partner's Total Income from Line 15000 of 2024 tax return. If the Applicant's spouse/partner has not filed a 2024 Tax Return, enter their estimated 2024 total income from all sources.

value.text: Section 5 - Must be completed and signed by an Awards Officer or Registrar’s Office at your school. It MUST be submitted with your entire application. Funding will be delayed when these instructions are NOT followed.
What is the student’s expected PERCENTAGE of a full course load?

span.#text: This application for student aid can cover part-time studies for up to 12 months, however, if the student is enrolled in more than one course and there is a 30 day gap between courses, the student must apply for student aid on a separate application.

value.text: Is the student taking all their courses in a correspondence/e-learning/distance study program?
School Stamp and confirmation that Study Dates are correct
*Round to the nearest dollar. Amounts must be in Canadian dollars.

span.#text: Only list courses for which the student will receive credit.

p.#text: List Course(s) for Current Study Period (mandatory)
If more than four courses, attach the information separately.

value.text: Have any of the courses listed above been taken previously by the student?

assist.speak: What is the student’s expected PERCENTAGE of a full course load? (must be less than 60%)

value.text: Campus Name (if not attending main campus)

p.#text: Application for Financial Assistance for Part-Time Post-Secondary Studies 2025-26

value.text: Do you want to be considered for a Part-time Canada Student Loan?
Have you received a Part-time Canada Student Loan from a province other than Alberta?
Are you a student with a disability?*
Section 6A - Requested Need - You can enter an amount below or, if you leave it blank, a calculation will be done.

span.#text: This student aid is intended to help cover the cost of tuition, books, travel and daycare (if applicable).

value.text: ●  *If yes, and you have previously provided documentation to confirm your disability, you do not have to submit more documents with this application, unless requested by Alberta Student Aid.
●  If yes, you may qualify for the Canada Student Grant for Students with Disabilities.
●  If yes, and you require assistive services or equipment, you may qualify for the Canada Student Grant for Student Services and Equipment - Students with Disabilities.
●  To apply for either Canada student grant, you must complete a Schedule 4. For assistance or more information, see the Disability Advisor/Reviewer at your school.
●  I will use any financial assistance awarded to me towards the cost of my education.
●  I have not applied to another province or territory for student financial assistance for the same period for which I am applying for funding in this Application.
●  provide information or documents as requested by Advanced Education to verify any statements made in this Application.
●  immediately notify Advanced Education in writing of any change in my address, marital or common law partner status, financial circumstances, academic status or study period.

●  I may be required to immediately repay any financial assistance I receive if there are any changes to my financial circumstances, marital or common law partner status, academic status or study period.

●  I may be denied financial assistance if I fail to notify Advanced Education in writing of any change in my financial circumstances, marital or common law partner status, academic status or study period, or fail to provide documents or information as requested by Advanced Education to verify statements made in this Application.

●  if I make a false or misleading statement in this Application, or fail to disclose information as requested by Advanced Education, I may be denied financial assistance, and/or required to immediately repay all financial assistance received, and/or subject to criminal prosecution.
●  I am not entitled to apply for or receive financial assistance from another province or territory for the same period of time that I am getting financial assistance from Advanced Education.
●  failure to disclose information or provide updated information as requested by Advanced Education may constitute the making of a false or misleading statement.
●  Advanced Education has the right to recover benefits I receive which I am not entitled to, including any benefits received due to administrative errors.
Section 7 - Applicant Consent and Declaration - Continued from Page 4.
If I receive financial assistance, I acknowledge the authority of, and where a consent is required hereby irrevocably authorize the Minister to disclose and exchange my personal information with:
I have read, understood, and agree to be bound by all of the consents and declarations contained within pages 4 and 5 of this Application.
Digital or Electronic Signature not accepted

span.#text: Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act

p.#text: Advanced Education is collecting this personal information under the authority of sections 33(a) and (c) of the

value.text: The personal information may be disclosed to:
●  I declare that my personal information included on this form is true and complete.
Digital or Electronic Signature not accepted
Alberta Student Aid PO Box 28000 STN MAIN Edmonton AB  T5J 4R4

●  the Government of Canada, the National Student Loans Service Centre, any provincial or territorial government department or agency, any lending institution where I may have a student loan, any educational institution or credit bureau for any purpose related to the verification of information provided by me and for administration and enforcement related to student financial assistance programs;

●  Employment and Social Development Canada through the Social Insurance Registry to verify my Social Insurance Number, name, date of birth, and gender solely to confirm identification for the purpose of financial assistance;

●  Alberta Seniors, Community and Social Services to operate and administer financial assistance programs, including determining my eligibility, and the eligibility of my spouse/partner, for financial assistance;

●  any of the following: lending institutions; credit bureaus; the educational institution(s) named in the Application; and any third party authorized to collect a debt owed to His Majesty the King in right of Alberta, in each case for any purpose relating to administration, enforcement or collection related to student financial assistance programs;

●  federal government departments or agencies or the educational institution(s) named in the Application to conduct research, statistical analysis, and evaluations related to student financial assistance programs.
● Alberta Student Aid: call the Alberta Student Aid Service Centre at 1-855-606-2096.

span.#text: Freedom of Information and Protection of Privacy Act

value.text: ●  federal, provincial or territorial government departments or agencies or educational institutions named in this Application, to verify information the Applicant provided, determine the eligibility of the Applicant for financial assistance and to administer student financial assistance programs.
●  the federal government for use in research, statistical analysis and evaluations related to student financial assistance programs.
●  Alberta Seniors, Community and Social Services to operate and administer financial assistance programs, including your eligibility, and the eligibility of the Applicant, for financial assistance.

●  any lending institution or credit bureau to verify any information the Applicant provided, to determine the eligibility of the Applicant for financial assistance and to administer student financial assistance programs.
●  the Applicant for the purposes of determining and verifying the Applicant’s eligibility for financial assistance.
Send documents electronically. If this is the first time you are applying or you applied using a paper application, you will NOT have access to Upload Documents.

text.#text: Application for Financial Assistance for Part-Time Post-Secondary Studies 2025-26
Students apply on this application for student financial assistance to attend part-time post-secondary studies.
